current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to
		  ensure that valid generic drugs may enter the market.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health,
			 Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and
			 referred to the

			 Generic Drugs Act

				time period, such an action was withdrawn or dismissed by a court (including a
				district court) without a decision that the patent was valid and infringed; or
				if an action was brought within such time period and was not withdrawn or so
				dismissed, such applicant has obtained the decision of a court (including a
				district court) that the patent is invalid or not infringed (including any
				substantive determination that there is no cause of action for patent
				infringement or invalidity, and including a settlement order or consent decree
				signed and entered by the court stating that the patent is invalid or not
				infringed).

Limitations on
			 agreements to defer commercial marketing date

				commercial marketing of its drug on the earliest possible date after receiving

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:527
Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505/ss:j/p:5/sp:F
Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505A
Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:527

Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505/ss:j/p:5/sp:B/cl:vii/scl:I/i:bb

text.#text:
An agreement described in this
				subclause is an agreement between a first applicant and the holder of the
				application for the listed drug or an owner of one or more of the patents as to
				which any applicant submitted a certification qualifying such applicant for the
				180-day exclusivity period whereby that applicant agrees, directly or
				indirectly, (aa) not to seek an approval of its application that is made
				effective on the earliest possible date under this subparagraph,

header.#text:
Agreement to defer approval or
				commercial marketing date

text.#text:
An agreement described in
				this subclause is an agreement between an applicant and the holder of the
				application for the listed drug or an owner of one or more of the patents as to
				which any applicant submitted a certification qualifying such applicant for the
				180-day exclusivity period whereby that applicant agrees, directly or
				indirectly, not to seek an approval of its application or not to begin the
				commercial marketing of its drug until a date that is after the expiration of
				the 180-day exclusivity period awarded to another applicant with respect to
				such drug (without regard to whether such 180-day exclusivity period is awarded
				before or after the date of the agreement).

header.#text:
Agreement that disqualifies
				applicant from first applicant status

Agreement by first applicant to
				defer commercial marketing; limitation on acceleration of deferred commercial
				marketing date

text.#text:
the applicant may seek an approval

Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505A

				regard to any other provision of such agreement pursuant to which the
				commercial marketing could begin on an earlier date; or

text.#text:
the latest date set forth in the
				agreement on which that applicant can receive an approval that is made
				effective under this subparagraph,
